Origins: In November 2013 the online version of the American Spectator published an opinion piece by Andrew B. Wilson that opened with a section describing the Obama administration's plans to dismantle the Statue of Liberty and ship it back to France:
Description: Links and excerpts referencing that article have since been circulated via social media, with many of those encountering it mistaking the information about the United States' sending the Statue of Liberty back to France for a genuine news report. However, that part of the editorial was not meant to be taken literally: rather, it was a farcical conceit employed by the author as a framework for his criticisms of President Obama.
Example: [Collected via e-mail, November 2013] Any truth to this? I really don't think so, but you never know. President Obama is now prepared to order the immediate dismantlingof the statue for shipment back to France in early 2014.
Claim: The United States is returning the Statue of Liberty to France.
